page.title: 01ARNE PENINSULA-POOLE HARBOUR
page.content: The Arne Peninsula with Round and Long Islands close by are situated in Poole Harbour opposite the busy port of Poole. The area is practically uninhabited and a Nature Reserve is situated here.This consists of 1,300 acres which are mainly open heathland,a type of habitat which is rapidly disappearing in Dorset. This is the home of one of Britain's rarest birds, the Dartford Warbler. Conservationists fear that the development of the natural deposits of oil in the harbour will affect the reserve. Access to most of the reserve is restricted. The survey covers Local History,Clay Mining,Buildings,the lack of Amenities,descriptions of the ecology and the Shipstal Nature Trail.
